summary_hypothesis: Research hypothesis: Compound LM-12 may warrant evaluation for equine laminitis support pathways.

why_failed_originally.summary: Human vascular trial used short-term perfusion endpoints that did not reflect longer-term outcomes.
key_points: Trial endpoints focused on short-term perfusion and missed chronic outcomes.

why_it_might_work_in_animals.summary: Equine laminitis endpoints emphasize functional outcomes, potentially aligning better with the mechanism.
key_points: Different clinical outcome measures in equine care pathways.
Laminitis management may leverage perfusion support hypotheses.

evidence.notes: Evidence is research-only and requires validation.

executive_summary: Compound LM-12: human trial focused on short-term perfusion endpoints that may not translate to chronic outcomes.
Equine laminitis endpoints differ and could align with perfusion support hypotheses.
Veterinary evidence is weak and mechanistic only.
Risk profile is high; not recommended for further pursuit.
reasoning_summaries.failure_summary: Human trial endpoints were misaligned with chronic outcomes; failure type: trial_design.

species_benefit_summary.summary: Equine laminitis outcome measures may align differently with perfusion support hypotheses.

reasoning_summaries.evidence_summary: Veterinary evidence is weak and limited to mechanistic signals.
reasoning_summaries.risk_summary: Risk profile is high (72/100). Not recommended for further pursuit.

disclaimer: Research hypothesis only; not medical advice.
